title: QoL buff for Azir, show attack radius of soldiers when placing.
body:
I tried out Azir last week when he was on free rotation. He was a lot of fun, but I found his soldier placement kinda wonky/clunky.

So I was thinking, it would have helped a bit if instead of a normal targeting reticule, the cast indicator was instead an AoE indicator with their attack range.

Would/could this be a nice thing to have or would it just be annoying?

replies.body: That's a great idea! I'm gonna see if I can get a version of this in. I keep forgetting people play without smartcast. My bad!

I use smartcast w/ range indicators.

Best of both worlds.

^.^

Omg is the mighty Zenon! My fav designer :3

 Please Zenon, back to the Warwick rework I really love your rework kit. Warwick really needs it.

They have a circle around them that shows their range.  More over azir has an indicator for everything if you know what to look for.

Just saying it seems unnecessary.

I know they have a range indicator after they appear.

What I want is a preview of that when I'm casting so I can see what i'm gonna get, where I can place them to reach what parts of a minion wave, or an enemy champion and such.

Stuff you get a feel for eventually I presume, but it could be nice to have anyway.
i never see those anyway.... smartcast op
QoL buff for azir, no cast time for W
